alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 9:11AM CDT until May 16 at 6:27AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River near Speaks affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. For the Navidad River...including Speaks, Morales, Strane Park... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River near Speaks. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins with the river one hundred yards wide in the vicinity of the gauge. The approaches to the FM 530 bridge are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 23.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 25.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.3 feet on 11/26/1985. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Navidad River Speaks 24.0 23.0 Sun 9 am CDT 25.4 21.2 15.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 915 PM CDT.
